Overall%20Experience.Review: Amazing school, I loved attending all 4 years. Could not recommend it more to anyone looking for a fun and engaging college life.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: Amazing! I love this university with all the opportunities, hospitality, and academic challenges it provides. It has an amazing balance between academic and social life, something significant to me.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: I‚Äôm a Tulane alum and current parent.  As someone with deep Louisiana and New Orleans roots I am appalled by the attitudes of Tulane students and their parents towards New Orleans.  Most treat it like an amusement park where they can eat beignets and watch Mardi Gras parades without any appreciation or respect for the rich history and traditions of the area.  FYI, Mardi Gras is based in Catholicism.  Tulane needs to do a better job of educating New Orleanians and Louisianans who have an interest in staying in the community and advocating for local issues instead of giving Northeast kids a four-year fun-trip down south.  Their parents are just as bad.  They do nothing but appropriate the culture and then leave.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Graduate Student

Overall%20Experience.Review: My overall experience at Tulane University has been a blend of academic growth, cultural exposure, and personal development. One of the aspects I‚Äôve appreciated the most is the diverse campus life. The opportunity to interact with people from various backgrounds has been enriching. Academically, Tulane has offered me a challenging yet rewarding environment, particularly within my field of study: Cell & Molecular Biology. The strong networking opportunities at Tulane have also been a significant advantage. I believe there could be more resources for community engagement. While Tulane is already deeply connected to New Orleans, further fostering partnerships with local organizations and creating more opportunities for students to engage with the city would enrich the college experience even more.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: Tulane is an open diverse campus..Opportunity is available if you seek it out. The university provides several different forms of study.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: Tulane University is such an amazing school, and being in New Orleans makes it even better. New Orleans' rich culture to Tulane makes school 10 times more fun, beautiful, and unique. I'd choose Tulane over and over again.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: I really liked my experience at Tulane because I loved the greater city of New Orleans. I also had some awesome professors in the school of Public Health. I had some not so great professors for the hard sciences, and one class was fully taught by a graduate student that did not have enough experience. The food at Tulane during my time was BAD but I've heard it has improved. I would recommend Tulane to all my friends as it completely shaped who I am today.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: Do not come here. The academics are terrible yet professors grade extremely harshly. They do not care about their student body at all and make everything ten times harder and more complicated than it needs to be. Speaking of student body, there is zero diversity, everyone is either from California, Chicago, or New York, not to mention rude, snobby , and narcissistic. The going out scene is nothing other than trashy. Blacking out every night of the week, drugs, etc. (well aware that is part of college but a whole new level here). Housing is disgusting. Freshman dorms are the worst. Every type of mold, bodily fluids, and only cleaned properly once or twice a year, not to mention haven‚Äôt been renovated at all in over 20 years. Mail pickup is ridiculous, class registration is even more ridiculous (no words can describe how horrible it is). New Orleans is ‚Äúfun‚Äù but extremely dangerous. Only pro is food and garden district is great. People praise this school for literally nothing, it sucks.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: DO NOT GO HERE! I am a freshman and the academics are terrible. There are full departments (math, chemistry, etc.) that are so bad that you are advised to take online courses over the summer instead. Not only that, but class registration is impossible. I am paying 45k per semester to take few to no credits that go toward my major. Basically, taking random classes because there are not enough classes or professors for the lower level classes to accommodate everyone who needs to take them.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: The school is really amazing. The classes and academics are good. The best thing about Tulane is the location.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Other

Overall%20Experience.Review: Tulane's campus is absolutely breathtaking. The scenery is beautiful and there is lots of diversity. There's a place for everyone.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: Tulane University, located in New Orleans, offers a unique blend of academic rigor and vibrant culture. The campus is beautiful and the social scene in unparalleled. Tulane is an excellent choice for students who want both rigor, a unique cultural experience and an incredible social scene.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: New Orleans is an awesome city to live in, and Tulane has lots of opportunities across a wide variety of topics. Obviously, as a top party school, it definitely values the "work hard, play hard" ethic, but it's not that hard to find people who prioritize one or the other.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: Tulane is filled with a lively campus energy balanced with an academically driven student body. The school is the definition of work hard, play hard(er)!
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: Tulane is a place that not only offers a variety of unique programs, but also allows you to mix and match programs to your liking. I truly believe that Tulane is the university that offers the most well-rounded college experience out there.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: I like the flexibility because I can work full time and continue my education. There is a lot of opportunity to connect to other students and I know the instructors are always available for help.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Graduate Student

Overall%20Experience.Review: Tulane is an amazing school to be at, it is so much fun and it has such a welcoming atmosphere. The surrounding area of New Orleans is an amazing place to live and I am so happy I chose to come here.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: Tulane is amazing‚Ä¶ they have so many resources for students, the campus is beautiful, academics and professors are above average. Tulane is the best university in the country.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: My first two years at Tulane University have been an incredible blend of academic rigor and an amazing social life. The classes I have taken are challenging and engaging, pushing me to grow both intellectually and personally. The vibrant and unique campus life has provided me with unforgettable experiences and lifelong friendships. I am very grateful for my experience so far, and would like to continue my education at Tulane; however, the high cost of attendance has been a significant source of stress, as it‚Äôs challenging to manage financially without sufficient aid. Despite this, I can't imagine being anywhere else, and I hope Tulane can find ways to make education more accessible for all students. It would also be a nice change if Tulane improved resources to help students find real scholarships that make a difference.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: Tulane has so many amazing opportunities to get connected and find your niche! There is truly something for everyone here.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: Personally I love Tulane and all that it has to offer from school spirit to its overall environment. I genuinely just love everything about it.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: I am an international student and I had a chance to meet up with sophomore students at Tulane with Dr. Casey Love and it was a wonderful experience. At first, I had no idea what studying at Tulane would be like since I haven‚Äôt met any single soul at Tulane in person, which is why I was so nervous about going to New Orleans. But when I had the opportunity to gather and talk with current students at Tulane, my viewpoint completely changed. Everyone there was so welcoming, genuine and humorous. It was different from everywhere I have been to because I felt warm-hearted by Tulanies‚Äô sympathy and hospitality towards new students like me. Dr. Love was so welcoming and gave me a handful of advice to help me prepare a lot for my journey in the future. Just by meeting people at Tulane, I can see myself adapting and growing in the future at such a great and diverse community where there are a plenty of programs for international students. I firmly believe that Tulane is such an amazing society.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: Great campus. It's gorgeous. Campus safety is a top priority. My program is every Saturday and Sunday so we eat breakfast and lunch. The chefs are trained in New Orleans. The food is fantastic.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Graduate Student

Overall%20Experience.Review: As an art major at Tulane University, every thing was amazing. I enjoy the graphic design, print making, and glass blowing classes. I would like to see more art classes or just a different approach to that major in general. Other than that, Tulane itself is a phenomenal school.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Other

Overall%20Experience.Review: Tulane University is such an incredible place for so many reasons. Because it is not said enough, the quality of professors here is absolutely unbelievable. The campus is beautiful, the students are happy, and the weather is perfect, minus the rain. The academics are rigorous but manageable, leaving time to get involved in extracurriculars, explore New Orleans, or anything else you want to do. New Orleans is an amazing and fun city with so much to see! The class sizes, at least for me personally, have been so small, and the relationships I have built with my professors are so special. The social climate can be a bit tough to manage for introverts or for those who do not enjoy going out often, but once you find your niche it is a non-issue. The academics are super flexible, and I'm able to graduate early despite choosing to study abroad! The culture and the people here are truly special, and I urge anyone interested in Tulane to consider checking it out and applying!
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: Tulane is alright. The professors are usually nice and invested in helping you succeed in your goals. Tulane is really flexible with what you can major and minor in, which is nice, but if you want to major or minor in something a little more uncommon, they probably don't have it. Their language selection is incredibly small, as well. While the professors are super interested in helping students succeed, they are the only people, really. I'm convinced my financial counselor doesn't care about me and it seems that most of the admin are that way, was well. The Riley Center (the gym) is great, though.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: Tulane is has a very homogenous student body that is in no way reflective of the culture of New Orleans or Louisiana.  If you are looking for a New York or Miami culture it is here.  It does make me laugh when students really think they know anything about New Orleans.  Aren't you surrounded by the same people you were at home?
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: I've had a great time at Tulane so far! Professors are sometimes questionable, but overall I have truly enjoyed my education here and it's opened so many career doors for me!
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: Tulane is awesome. I had accommodations and they were always abided by. Very fun. Frat life isnt great but city life in Nola makes up for it
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: Diverse academic offerings, vibrant campus life, and engaging pre-college programs. Excited for scholarship opportunities!
Overall%20Experience.Author: Other

Overall%20Experience.Review: Tulane university is the ultimate college experience. You have the campus in a mid size southern city in a residential neighborhood, and the easily accessible downtown area with culture and food available 24/7. Yes New Orleans is a party city with Mardi Gras, Jazz fest and bourbon street, but Tulane offers an uptown oasis where students can learn from amazing professors in academically rigorous programs. Additionally Tulane might be a small expensive sounding private university, but they offer plenty of financial assistance, both needs based and academic based. The student life in a city like New Orleans is unmatched, if you are smart enough to take advantage of it. I myself was an undergraduate business school student and can say the professors and the programs offered for prepared me and my friends very well for the real world. I found the student body to be diverse despite what the rankings say, with 75% of students coming from 500 or more miles away.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: Tulane is  a great school that has a balance between it's academics and social atmosphere. It is a beautiful campus outside of the city but still within New Orleans. There are some great professors with lots of passion and expertise as well. The school has serious areas of improvement regarding it's student support resources, diversity, and response to student concerns.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: Tulane is the perfect school for a very niche group of students which includes very wealthy students. Never the less, the school has the perfect amount of students , and the campus is beautiful. With a little background research, teachers are overall caring and very good at teaching. In all, the school provides a cultivating environment for academically rigorous students while also providing a fun atmosphere at all times.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: As a graduate student in my field I found it extremely exhausting. Overworked and under paid. Or lots of times not paid at all.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Graduate Student

Overall%20Experience.Review: Tulane fosters an incredibly flexible environment that is fully catered for the student to grow. The academics are challenging but there are many resources that one can go to to recieve guidance. Tulane's community is very strong and everyone who attends, wants to be there.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: I have had an amazing past 2 years at this university. The weather is great, the location is unmatched and the atmoshphere is lively. For the most part, people are friendly and the campus has a great vibe. Dorms and food might need a bit of work but they are getting there.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: I want to see a more diverse campus. Whether that be socio economically, through race, religion or area.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: Loved this school.  New Orleans was a great place to go to college.   The professors were very knowledgeable and accessible.  Big party scene as there was a bar practically on campus.  The campus was beautiful and well maintained.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: I love Tulane. It definitely is a hard school depending on your major and how you balance your life. Almost everyone I know has a double major
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: Tulane is a "work hard, play hard" kind of school. You will learn to manage you work and social life, and grow a lot as a student.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: I have been at Tulane University for a few months and so far I really like my experience. The teachers are very understanding and communicative. I do not see anything I want to change about the school.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: Tulane university is generally  a great university with great student to staff ratio and great teachers. There is also a great sense of Community at Tulane making it easy for new freshman to adapt. One critical point of Tulane is the college itself needs some remodeling. There are buildings at Tulane that have been there since Hurricane Katrina.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: I love Tulane for everything it has to offer. The community it creates by connecting students to the greater New Orleans area and making sure all students have the opportunity to be involved is truly invaluable. The city is incredible, the classes are great, and students are pushed to become not just better students, but better people.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review:
The student life is great. International students are provided with adequate resources to help them through school. I am currently on the International Students Advisory Board and the Law School Ambassador for Tulane African Students Association.
There are enough students resources to cater for the social life and mental health of students.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Graduate Student

Overall%20Experience.Review: I have loved my time at Tulane, the atmosphere is amazing and the non-lecture professors have all been great. I believe my education is being facilitated well at Tulane and I love the spirit of the school.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: Decent school but math department is horrible, greek life is very important the schools's social scene, very large jewish community
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review:
Attending Tulane University has been a transformative experience for me. Nestled in the heart of New Orleans, Tulane offers an academic environment that's as vibrant and diverse as the city it calls home. The fusion of cultures, combined with the university's commitment to community engagement, has deeply enriched my educational journey.

However, attending Tulane is not without its challenges. As someone concerned about inclusivity, I feel the university could further diversify its student body and faculty. This diversity is crucial for fostering a more inclusive environment where all voices are heard and valued.

In summary, my time at Tulane has been filled with learning, personal growth, and unforgettable experiences. The university's strengths in academics, community engagement, and cultural richness have made my college years exceptional. Yet, there's room for growth in areas like diversity and financial accessibility, which I hope to see evolve in the coming years.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: If you‚Äôre priority is getting wasted whenever and wherever, this is the place for you. A great time if you‚Äôre loaded, otherwise look forward to the suffocating pressure of trying to meet Tulane social expectations, especially as a girl (they might not tell you this, but the student body is roughly 70% female‚Ä¶sounds great until you realize these are truly the most insecure, entitled people you have ever met. Save yourself 100k and as well as the hassle of endless scamming, poorly operated systems, and generally miserable people
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: Do not come here if you are a gay woman and I mean it. There are gay people, but the intensity of the heteronormative culture is unescapable. You will feel like a token, you will feel out of place. If you want to spend your college experience watching straight girls make out in frats, this is the place for you. There is no ‚Äúqueer community‚Äù, just the few gay people you can find and therefore have to be friends with. From the way people dress to what they talk about, it‚Äôs a student body completely centered around straight greek life. If you come from a homophobic background this will be better, but if you ask any queer person from the North, they will tell you how disappointing it is here. Do yourself a favor and believe me so you don‚Äôt make the same mistake I did.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: I love Tulane. The atmosphere is great. I can get into most classes I want. Most of the professors are amazing and have great connections. They really want their students to succeed and have a lot of really cool programs that allow students to get into grad schools and jobs they want.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: DO NOT DO Spring Scholars!  It was miserable!  It is one thing to study abroad after experiencing the growing pains of college in a normal environment this is another awful debilitating experience.  This robs kids of the ability to go to college, establish a network of friends, participate in clubs and sports, and join Greek life.  Everything you see posted online, orientation, convocation, club days, football game, homecoming and parent‚Äôs weekend you and your family will be excluded from.  All of the clubs have try outs either in the Spring for the next year or the Fall for that year so Spring Scholars are excluded from all clubs and sports for an entire year.  They are forced to live with upper classman who already have an established network so even their roommates alienate them.  They start out behind on coursework and have to take an extra year to catch up (don‚Äôt believe Tulane when they say otherwise).  Kids ony have four years in college and Spring Scholars ruins the experience.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review:
Tulane boasts a very happy public image. I became very depressed weeks after starting my freshman fall, and later learned I was not alone. Many of my best friends also struggled and felt like many of the programs advertised were surface-level and not reaching the target audiences. Tulane is great for extroverted students but turns a blind eye to struggling introverts. 
The president is another example of this surface-level, front-facing imaging the university displays. On paper, he looks very smart and qualified for the position. In reality, he is very aloof and takes a neutral or even no stance on issues that should matter to him and his students. If there is an incident on campus, in the US, or a major global incident, he will send out a generic statement from his office. When he walks around campus, he is treated like a celebrity and is flaunted at sporting events. 
I would like to see the university actually connect with their students.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: There are many benefits to being a Tulane Student, the school provides transportations, gym facilities, food court and so many other things to do on campus, as well as a chance to work or find an internship.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: I love Tulane. I'm a Communication and Digital Media Practice major and every single one of my classes challenges and motivates me towards my goal of becoming a director. Being a woman of color in film is hard, but Tulane and my peers make it worth it.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: Tulane is the best school in the states. Best social and academic life balance. Great sports and party scene
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: Tulane's inclusivity is what really pops out to me. There are so many people from different backgrounds. Everyone is always interested in learning more about you. I have done Tulane's pre-college program for the past 3 years and every year learn something different about myself. I am accepted for who I truly am. Tulane has made me realize that showing our differences to each other is another level of intimacy with our friends. We should be embarrassed about it we should be excited to show others who we are. There isn't anything I would change because if it were different I might've not have learned that differences are what brings us together.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Other

Overall%20Experience.Review: Great school, perfect size at about 8000 undergrads. Small enough to get individualized learning. You're still able to see people you know around while also meeting new people. The professors are great. So many resources like the counseling center and case management are great.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: Had Tulane disclosed Spring Scholars was an option for early decision applicants I would not have let me child apply ED.  What an incredibly manipulative way to ask kids to demonstrate interest in a school and then use that interest to have them make up for lost tuition.  I looked over everything on the admission page and nothing says applying ED can result in a compromised inferior college experience by being admitted as a Spring Scholar.  My child‚Äôs SS experience was miserable.  By the time they made it to Tulane in January it was difficult to make friends and every Greek house cut them giving the reason they were a SS.  The SS counselor couldn‚Äôt be bothered to meet with them to help make up for the late start and lack of courses available in the Spring they needed.  Do not fall for this baith and switch trap, it is not worth it.   My child transferred out.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: I have had a great time at Tulane so far. The University supplies students with an abundant amount of opportunities within their majors, diversifying portfolios by taking classes outside of their majors as well, providing students with support systems such as Case Management, mental health providers or academic advisors when a student needs further assistance sometimes if they're struggling with balance, and time to enjoy going out and exploring the scenery and unique atmosphere of New Orleans. The only downside many students pertained to was the balance between school work and social life and the cost of attendance. I myself really need help with paying for my college tuition which is around $83,000 a year and I didn't know how hard it would be with a single mother who is a nurse practitioner still trying her best to help with everything yet it's not enough. Tulane needs to provide students with more financial care along with teaching students how to be responsible with balance.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: The international programs are difficult to navigate.  This year the Italian program had no housing despite Tulane promising housing would be provided and visas were difficult to get (some didn‚Äôt come in time and kids were left stranded).  Tulane leaves these students high and dry and just tells them DON‚ÄôT COME TO NEW ORLEANS AND TRY AND MAKE FRIENDS SO YOU HAVE A NORMAL COLLEGE EXPERIENCE.  Starting Spring semester was painful and ruined the college experience all together.  There are no opportunities to connect with others.  Seems like a way to defer a lot of full pay qualified students to make room for those who are not, knowing they will drop out.  Incredibly manipulative and on the verge of being unethical.  Students should be treated as more than just a way to make up for lost tuition through attrition. I would have rather they rejected my child then admit them as a SS.  I wonder if the demographics of SS are the same as the rest of the class.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: The campus grounds are absolutely beautiful. Walking to class is a pleasure in itself as I get to enjoy the wonderful scenery. As for my experience in the School of Liberal Arts, my teachers have been wonderful. I've only had a great experience during my time at Tulane.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: although I went in with some initial skepticism, I could not imagine a better school. there is quite literally something for everyone, meaning there is no single "typical tulane student." the orientation & first year peer mentor program is incredible - as long as you embrace it. i can't wait to go back in august. i love my professors, friends, sorority, pre professional fraternity, clubs, the exercise classes, the fly, the food, the parties, the academic, and everything in between. üíöüíöüíöüíö
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: I go into my first year this fall but from the tours and university modules for first years on canvas, I can already tell that Tulane wants their students to be happy and succeed.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: I like the campus and how connected it is. I would like to see the engineering program improve as engineering physics is very broad I would like to see actual engineering majors be offered like civil and mechanical
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: The team has been great throughout the application and in-processing experience. I get updated information to support my educational goals.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Graduate Student

Overall%20Experience.Review: Growing up school was never a strong suit of mine. Coming to tulane I was finally given the opportunity to study hard and focus on my academics. I have reached great success at Tulane due to my commitment and drive for learning more.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: professors and advisors are caring and always put their students first. I began taking online classes and they made the transition easy
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: Experience at this university has been very mixed. The math program has offered me the least competent teachers I've ever experienced, and I've heard equally bad things about the chemistry department, but all of the other academics seem to be incredibly sound.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: Hard to adjust to compared to living anywhere else in the world, hard classes, difficult to schedule classes, not many options for classes, most of the classes that you take are required for your major,
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review:
There is always something to do and you have every opportunity to try something new. The classes aren't too big, depending on your major. Greek life is a large part of Tulane's culture, but even if you decide not to participate, that's okay. Mardi Gras is something you shouldn't miss, and Tulane prepares its students for the festivities to their best ability by providing anything you would need from water bottles to vitamins. 

Besides the partying Tulane, the university gives its students every opportunity to be successful with their success coaches to guide you along the way and encourage you to try something new and the extensive networking events.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: I loved Tulane because the campus was beautiful and New Orleans is very sunny so the aurora of going to class made me feel happy. I liked the classes I took such as Cultural Anthropology, Nazi Cinema, Oil Painting, Abstract Painting, and Music theory. A lot of professors were very helpful with academics and it was very challenging with my double major in Digital Media Production and Studio Art, minor in Film Studies but the experience was worth it. I also loved the events Tulane would have on campus and cultural events that would let you explore he city in a bus owned by Tulane. It's very well-rounded college and full of campus events to go to that boosted morale.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: I am proud to be a student at Tulane. The teachers are compassionate and really care about the success of every student.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: Tulane stands out amongst other universities with its combination of competitive academics, athletics, and student life. Tulane is in one of the most culturally rich cities in the world. and is ranked as the number one university with the happiest students. In addition to this, the network that Tulane provides to its students is second to none.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review:
Decent overall experience. Overrated academics, very mixed bag in terms of strong departments/weak departments. 

Social life revolves around partying. Clubs/organizations are not as active as they should be. 

New Orleans is a great city.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: I love Tulane and everything it has to offer.  I love the small classes and being automatically enrolled in all the schools at Tulane giving me the ability to take classes in different areas of interest and possibly giving me the opportunity to expand my interests.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: Tulane University is on the come up. Seriously, if you work hard play hard, put this school on your list. It is a must-see. One of the most BEAUTIFUL campuses, amazing professors and faculty, endless student orgs and clubs, great location, great food, great athletics. The party scene? Unparalleled. At least come down for a tour to enjoy the 80 degree weather in February, and because there's no application fee, there's no harm in applying!
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: I am currently in the beginning of my second semester as a freshman here at Tulane, and the experiences I have had here are not entirely what I was expecting. This is for both good and bad reasons. Beginning with something positive. The campus and environment are beautiful. New Orleans is like no other place I have ever been. Growing up in Wisconsin, there was a limited amount of diverse experiences that I was exposed to.  Additionally, most of the professor's are great, they are engaged with the students and value the classroom experience. Moving on to an aspect of my experience that was not so positive, was finding out that work study jobs are not guarenteed and that their health insurance is mandatory for all students if you do not have a "sufficient enough" provider yourself. As someone who was heavily relying on financial aid and scholarships, this was extremely schocking. Overall, I have so much love for Tulane, I just wish they were more mindful of their students demographics.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: I like the student life, as well as the athletics and campus life. It's still lacking diversity, but they're working to change that.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: Tulane is a perfect school for high achieving students who still want a "college" experience.  Tulane's location in New Orleans makes it the perfect environment for students to explore the diversity of the city. Between Mardi Gras, Jazz Fest, and other events, there is always a reason to celebrate and have fun. Tulane University is ranked highly in student happiness for a reason. Professors are very understanding and accommodating, allowing students to work toward their degree without unnecessary stress and panic.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: I absolutely love Tulane. It's a place where I can really dive into my academic interests while having fun and trying new things in New Orleans. It is the perfect place to have the quintessential American college experience.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: I love how Tulane opens doors for students to engage with all of their intellectual and professional interests without much red tape. My friends at other schools cannot engage with different departments and courses as easily as I feel we do at Tulane. Tulane prepares students for success, whether that be through post-grad fellowships, jobs, or many many other paths. The campus feels quite safe and it has access to the street car line.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: I love the atmosphere on the Tulane Campus, everyone is so welcoming and loves to chat. I feel as though my professors have my best interest in mind and can really thrive in this supportive environment.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: Tulane is a great university for academics, and I truly don't think that I would have enjoyed my major and other academic programs as much at another school. I have met amazing friends here, and the city of New Orleans is an indescribably amazing place.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: Tulane has so many opportunities for students! Between providing support services across campus, having great faculty and staff, and setting up students with well-equipped job opportunities, Tulane has it all.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: Almost all Tulanians I meet are so happy to be there. New Orleans is a wonderful city with a rich culture and nightlife, and students have many varied interests that make it easy to find your people. Most students take school seriously, but are not competitive with one another and know how to have fun. Roll wave!
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: Caring professors. Tight-knit school community. A beautiful campus, and an amazing city. I couldn‚Äôt imagine having a more perfect college experience and education.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: Local, Loves it. Grew up here and decided to go to college here because Tulane gave me a lot of scholarship money. I have no regrets. Another reason I chose Tulane was because of the academics, along with it being an instate school but having an out of state feel. Roll wave!
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: best choice for university in retrospect. good work life balance, plentiful academic opportunities, supportive student body and administration. occasional safety issues due to living in NOLA.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: Tulane has seamlessly blended top-notch education with a great social atmosphere that makes you excited to get up each day. From the classrooms to the Riley gym to the close off-campus bars, there's always something to do on this campus.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: A beautiful campus with amazing people and a solid community holding it together. Wouldn't want to be anywhere else.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: Tulane is a wonderful institution with endless opportunities for student success. As a well-respected private university, Tulane is willing to offer assistance financially, academically, and physically to anyone who really wants to be a part of the Green Wave community. Tulane truly is home to me, and I'm so lucky that I have been given the opportunity to call New Orleans home.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: I transferred here and it was the best decision I've ever made. I couldn't imagine a better environment to go to college in. Of course, we live up to the party school reputation, but it doesn't mean you have to be a party animal to enjoy it. I will note that the admissions here are incredibly focused on demonstrated interest. They want to push the acceptance rate down by increasing their yield (which has worked very well). If you want to come here, you have to apply for either Early Action or Early Decision. Also, make sure they know that you really want to go here. Put some effort into the "Why Tulane?" essay and make sure to either visit or be very engaged virtually. There are online events and virtual tours that you can attend and sign up for. They will track your engagement through this.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: Tulane University is so fun and lively. The classes are interesting and valuable, and the professors are very passionate and care about their students' success. The campus environment is amazing, and there is an abundance of student resources. The city of New Orleans is a blast, and uptown New Orleans is relatively safe. I may be biased as a student at Tulane, but I genuinely believe it is the best university, and I am so happy with my decision to attend. Tulane University is a community, and I encourage anyone interested to apply. Roll Wave!
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: Attending Tulane was easily one of the best choices I have ever made in life. I highly recommend any senior in high school consider attending Tulane.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: I personally enjoy Tulane's academics, the academics are really high quality and they actually care about their students education. And, they have amazing professors. However, the social life on campus isn't as great especially for students like me who doesn't fall into certain categories that's fit for a pwi like Tulane.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review:
I've enjoyed my time at Tulane so far, especially academically. The liberal arts school is really awesome - so many cool professors and interesting courses. 
The party culture can be a LOT, especially if you don't like staying up late or drinking. If you aren't a partier, finding friends isn't impossible, but it can be a little harder. Also, the diversity is pretty crappy. However, the OMA and OGSD are really awesome if you get involved.
I really like campus itself, and there's always stuff going on. Actual downtown New Orleans is pretty far away, but never inaccessible. Weirdly, our dining hall food is not very good, but there are so many cool restaurants to try with friends or family. I'd really recommend having people come visit you - it's a great way to get out and about to visit the city in a more touristy way. Overall, Tulane is a really cool place, with lots of academic freedom, and it's a great option for a prestigious education without so much pressure.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: I gave it 5 stars‚Ä¶that doesn‚Äôt mean I think Tulane is perfect. This city and school definitely comes with flaws like any other. Tulane has a very flexible course structure and for sure embodies the title of ‚ÄúLiberal education‚Äù (not political terminology). However with this flexibility comes a huge responsibility on the student to create a structure that works for them. You must be prepared to speak for yourself and keep yourself in line in an environment that has ALOT of distractions. The 5 stars comes from my absolute love of this school, student culture, and city despite some legitimate qualms and challenges I‚Äôve faced here. It‚Äôs definitely not for everyone, but if you love to open yourself to new experiences and a challenges you will have a fantastic time.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: Amazing university with great experience and knowledge. I feel proud to be a part of Tulane University
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: Nice campus, good people.  Excellent professors who care.  Moving in the right direction.  Good food offerings.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: Work hard, play hard. I partied harder than I probably should have and wound up doing better off than my friends who went to my state school that‚Äôs technically higher ranked than Tulane. The academic experience is exceptional, and the party aspect is like no where else.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: Best academic and party scene balance, as long as you work hard and stay focused, you‚Äôll have a great time.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: I LOVEEEE TULANE!!! coming from Wisconsin, i was worried about leaving home, but new orleans has become a second home. amazing professors, amazing party scene, amazing people
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: I love it!! Everyone here is so friendly and happy the only thing is that the campus health is a little lacking-takes forever to get an appointment!
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: Miss it. definitely. I loved it there and I wish I had stayed. Especially the resources the school made available to me personally; I could tell they wanted to help me do my best.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: decent school, not worth 80k by any means though. academics are decent, and i like how easy it is to double major. if you have a full ride, then i would say yes consider coming here, as there really is no other place quite like new orleans. but if not, please be careful when making your decision, especially if you're a POC student. the fact that niche gives tulane an A- in diversity is abhorrent. we deserve /maybe/ a C-, if even that. tulane likes to boast about how they're "improving" in this regard, but then they don't address the gap in retention rates between POC students and white students. there are some really great student orgs here like SOAR as well as the Office of Multicultural Affairs who from what i've heard provide a good support system for students of marginalized identities, but most other places on campus are going to be predominantly white spaces. if you're wealthy and white, then i'd say sure, come here, but if not, weigh in your other options before committing.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: I loved my academic experience at Tulane. Professors really care about their students and work hard to provide support. I have taken a lot of really interesting classes and enjoyed the conversations that came out of them. I gave the school a four because some of the resources they say they provide are confusing to navigate. Overall, I would say the faculty is excellent and the programs could use some work.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: I like that the Tulane campus isn't far from downtown and that it has eateries close to it. The campus is also very clean and you can appreciate all the pretty trees when walking to class. The classes have been difficult for me and I think each semester I was overloaded with classes I do wish I was advised to drop more classes or take less. My volleyball experience has been better than my academic experience at Tulane.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: I really enjoy going to Tulane. For me, the biggest success is the ability to study in multiple different areas (I am a triple major and nearly all of my friends are double majors). There was a lack of mentorship and student support, however.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: I really enjoy attending Tulane. The culture of New Orleans is awesome, and it is such a different experience for many students that have traveled to attend. The food is fantastic, and the campus is located in a great spot.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: Tulane provides a rigorous academic curriculum, a great social life, and access to involvement in the greater New Orleans community. It has a small student body that allows for more attention from professors and greater access to resources both on campus and in the city.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: There are many ways to get engaged on campus no matter what you want to do but you have to put yourself out there and try new things to have the best experience.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: Tulane is very expensive, which means the facilities are very nice, the staff is wonderful, and the on campus living is pretty decent. Tulane is always under construction because of hurricanes in New Orleans and the damage that the city has received over many years. Overall, the culture at Tulane can be run by Greek life or not. I feel like it is up to you to find your people on campus through clubs or organizations that you are interested in. Tulane is a great time in a city you'll fall in love with!
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: My time at Tulane University will be remembered as some of the best years of my life. I feel that since going there I have become smarter, more confident and just overall have grown a lot as a person. The one thing I wish that was stronger is the career services available to students in terms of getting internships and jobs. I know Tulane has a strong alumni network and I think it could be utilized better. Aside from that, I could not have asked for a better college experience. The people I met and culture I was able to immerse myself in was unlike any other. New Orleans is such a special city and I would strongly recommend that anyone who has the chance to live there, takes it. I will miss everything about my time at Tulane and am definitely envious of students who are just about to start their time there.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: Great mix of academics and social life! Classes are taught by professors, rather than TAs and are usually fairly small. Great choice for someone who wants to engage in a real city, but also wants that typical college feel.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: The city of new orleans is a great city full of many opportunities you can‚Äôt get anywhere else. The staff is extremely supportive. However, the campus needs to be more diverse
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: Tulane attracts a special, niche group of students by nature of being a southern ivy and located in New Orleans. My group of friends at Tulane consists of intelligent, driven, socialites who push me to strive for greatness while going out 4 nights a week.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review:
The academics were absolutely stellar. Wide variety of classes with lots of flexibility to take courses outside of your primary disciplines. I was even able to double major AND minor! The professors are also fantastic; super knowledgeable in their field. Even the TAs and PhD students who taught courses were engaging and knew their stuff.

The diversity and social scene of Tulane could use a bit of help. For a school in one of the most diverse cities in the country, the student body was VASTLY white-passing. The university is taking measures to make Tulane more accessible to BIPOC, though, which is a fantastic move to see. The social scene can at times feel overwhelmed by Greek life, but only if you are in Greek life or have friends who are in it. The variety of clubs and student orgs that Tulane offers is sure to help just about anyone find "their people," though.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: Tulane University is the epitome or work hard play hard. Not only is Tulane an academically rigorous school, but it is a highly social community as well. New Orleans is an incredible place to live, however campus is centered in uptown therefore it can create a sheltered bubble from the rest of the city. If you actively seek new opportunities and local favorites, you can break this bubble. Work load varies by major, but overall classes are an expected difficulty with a few exceptions (math and chem departments have their struggles). I am beyond happy I picked this school.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: tulane is the perfect combination of great academics and a school in a city that still has a campus feel! definitely a work hard/play hard school, theres no other school like it
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: Overall, Tulane is a fairly nice school. The academics are pretty good, and if your interested in fraternities/sororities then the party culture will be enjoyable for you. Campus politics are fairly liberal. Welcoming to LGBTQ+ minorities, somewhat welcoming to BIPOC minorities. The Uptown neighborhood is very safe relative to the greater city of New Orleans and fun to explore, and theres lots of good food and shopping around campus.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: Tulane University provides the perfect balance between a vigorous education and a fulfilling social life. I enjoy the beautiful campus and often take walks on the many sunny days that New Orleans experiences. The class sizes are perfect, even the large GE classes are a reasonable capacity. All of my professors have been overwhelmingly understanding and kind. Best school ever!
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: I love Tulane, but definitely think the school could be more diverse in both the student body and professors. I also think there should be an education major that's different from the psych/education major. Many students want to become teachers, and I think having an education major will be beneficial to creating the future educators of America and possibly other countries as well.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: I loved my education at Tulane, but not every professor was energetic and motivated, and counseling was lacking. I did not feel strongly supported throughout my experience, or very guided. Financial aid counseling was generic at best.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: From my own experience, Tulane University is a unique experience in comparison to other campuses as to whether its a good day or a bad day, there never seems to be a boring day. Dull moments hardly exists on campus due to amount of activity going on a day-to-day basis, along with that, is the beauty of the campus. It's a very appeasing to the eye view strolling down McAlister Place, and to the nearby Audubon Park. The academics are demanding, sometimes unreasonably so but that is a part of the challenge, I like to think.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: Still not committed but every student we met seems happy with their experience. All the staff members are very responsive and positive!
Overall%20Experience.Author: Niche User

Overall%20Experience.Review: My one year at Tulane has been incredible. There is a reason that every student here loves their undergraduate years, and I cannot imagine going to school anywhere else.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: Tulane University can‚Äôt manage anything correctly and they have no respect for their staff. I really do not like this school. Please do not come here.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: The motto "work hard play hard" is no joke. The school is difficult and one needs to study a LOT to succeed.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: Tulane is in the heart of New Orleans and provides every opportunity for an immersive educational experience!
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: Tulane is an amazing school in an amazing place! Tulane will open so many doors for you and there is no where else I would rather go to school. Roll Wave!
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review:
Loved Tulane's vibrant academic and social atmosphere! 

In terms of academics: I graduated in 2015 and while I was there it felt almost standard to double major but I never felt like I was in competition with my friends ro classmates. Everyone was smart but no one was competitive about it. Intially I was an economics and international development double major  but because of a study abroad trip I ended up adding French as a third. I'm thankful for the opportuntiy to explore different interests!

In terms of social life: I was not a big partier and still found my group of firends and took full advantage of the city.  New Orleans is so special and I hope someday to get back there.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: I had a great time at Tulane University. I received a generous scholarship for all 4 years, got into Creative Scholars Premedical Program that guaranteed acceptance to Tulane Medical School, and gained a lot of research and extracurricular experience during my undergraduate years. Diversity could be improved.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: Tulane has provided a pretty incredible experience regardless of the covid-19 pandemic. They have kept students safe while keeping classes mostly in person, and it has allowed for an experience as close to normal as possible.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: Nice people and great transition into college life. Amazing city with great culture. Superb academics and professors.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: Rigorous academics and an active student body. New Orleans adds to the college experience.  The dorms are very nice but the sports teams are average.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: Great education in an amazing city.  So many different courses of study available that you can explore anything of interest to you- and change your mind as you want! Great student organizations and support structure- if you need help it is out there to get it.  You will never be bored in New Orleans and will always have something to go and do off campus.  There are so many other universities in the area that it is easy to find new people if for some reason you need more than what Tulane offers you!  There are sports, Greek life, academic student organizations and just for fun groups!
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: I love how green Tulane University is! The campus is serene, the staff were super friendly and helpful.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: The best.                                                        .                                   .
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: I loved my experienced at Tulane. If you're looking for the perfect balance of fun and competitive academics, with world class faculty in the most incredible city, Tulane is for you.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: I liked that the stem teachers seemed to be very passionate about the subjects they teach. I would like to see an increase in diversity and more involved clubs.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: A good college that, unfortunately, has bad eggs. Most of my teachers were perfectly fine, and a good portion of my time spent there was enjoyable. Unfortunately, a pair of teachers soured it - my Calculus 2 teacher and one of my Literature teachers. The former was a tenured old man who, if you didn't show up on time, would lock his classroom door. The administration didn't care to do anything about it, as again, he was tenured, so I had to suffer a near failing grade because the walk from my previous class was more than ten minutes long. My second teacher was, to put it plainly, stoned out of her mind during class, and couldn't teach us for anything. It's the one and only class that I have ever gotten up and walked out of.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: One thing I would like to see change is making it easier for students to get into classes. Overall, I loved Tulane.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: Tulane has been a great experience for me. I would have like to see more changes coming from administration when students spoke up.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: Just an amazing place, one of the best college parties I‚Äôve ever been to. Overall would definitely want to go there, but it is such a hard school as well.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review:
I like many aspects of Tulane, but let the following information be just one example of how blatantly money-hungry they are. 

As a freshman you are required to pick from two meal plans, both $3,475. As a sophomore, you are also required to pick a meal plan. All of them are also $3,475. As a sophomore, you have 3 options, all $3,475, the best deal being TU7.

TU 7: --- $3,475
7 meal swipes
$1000 wave bucks
$50 nola bucks

TU 8 --- $1,295
8 meal swipes
Optional add on wave bucks or nola bucks

Juniors, who get to pick whether or not to get a meal plan, get to pick TU8. As you can see, TU8 is significantly cheaper and even if you chose to add on $1,000 Wavebucks and $50 nola bucks, it would be $2,345. 
My point is TU7 is $3,425, but if Sophomore's could get TU8, you could get a very similar plan for $2,345. However, they do not offer TU8 to us because they love to capitalize on overcharging us in WHATEVER WAY THEY CAN. If this didn't make sense go to the Tulane Dining Plan website.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: I visited the university last year and it just felt like home like i was where i belonged i loved the culture, air, and just the feeling of being there! It just felt like home!!!!!
Overall%20Experience.Author: Niche User

Overall%20Experience.Review: Tulane gave me an amazing education and offered very good financial aid. I hope to see more class and racial diversity at Tulane as the privileged culture was difficult to navigate for people who came from less-privileged backgrounds. Overall would recommend it as an educational experience.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: I liked the various class offerings, espeically unique and interesting topics. I would have liked to see more diversity within their students, staff, and leadership.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: I love Tulane, it has some things to work on but I have had a great experience. I received a lot of support to pursue my academic interests.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: Tulane made my transfer experience one that was truly unforgettable. Stepping into a new environment during your senior year is challenging enough, but Tulane aided me through the entire process and welcomed me with open arms. I instantly felt like I was at home and was surrounded by individuals who truly wanted to see me succeed.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: I loved my experience at Tulane Overall. One of the worst parts about Tulane is the student housing. Some of it is absolutely disgusting, and I got an upper respiratory infection from the mold growing in my freshman year dorm. Other than that, Tulane really works hard and plays hard, and it's a great balance between the two.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: Great college, awesome operation during the pandemic. Dorm is not so good but understandable, only one cafeteria, but food is fine. Do not need to claim a major till the second academic year which gives students more time to try things.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: I love tulane. Although freshman have a difficult time getting into classes they want, this will change as soon as their second semester. Tulane is the perfect work hard play hard environment where it does not matter if you are a part of Greek life or not. Everyone I know has loved their time here.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: I don't really fit the stereotype of Tulane students, so I had to look for 'my people,' but Tulane has a lot of opportunities to do so - the way I found my people was through my job, through Greek Life, and through various organizations. Once you find your pocket of people you really enjoy, life gets a lot easier - though I will say, if you don't fit the stereotype of typical Tulane students, it can be a little hard to get by at first. You can still be a thriving Tulane student if you don't drink, smoke, or party! The administration has made some questionable decisions, particularly relating to COVID, but that's a personal preference so be sure you look into how they've *actually* been dealing with COVID and student conduct, not just how they say they're dealing with it.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: I graduated from Tulane in 2008 and I have to say it was the most memorable 4 years of my young adulthood. Tulane is not only place for academics but also teaches you how to be a real adult. The school may not attract the students with the highest IQ but the graduates come out with strongest EQ to succeed in the real world. I highly recommend the school!
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: Tulane is a great school if you're pursuing either business or medicine. Tulane definitely needs more diversity; there is nothing but white students here on campus. The percentage of minorities here is very low.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: Took a database class in 2007.  The professor was very great!! It was a very interesting subject to complete my degree program!!!
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: Tulane was the perfect place for me. I loved the extracurriculars offered, my professors, and the individuality of the students. Getting to go to school in the city of New Orleans made the whole experience even more unique and provided me with many more learning opportunities.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: I love it here! The people are amazing and the classes are great. The new Commons has great food. The clubs are the best, there is always something to do.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: Overall, while education wise Tulane is a great choice, the school doesn't fit New Orleans. It is a bunch of rich NY, NJ, and CA kids who come to NOLA to party.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: I'm pretty happy with my experience so far, with academics and campus life. Though there is a lack of diversity, the multitude of multicultural organizations (at least this year) are really trying to support minority students. The most evident lack of diversity is in the socioeconomic status between students. You can find those who won't party/uber/eat out every day of the week, but they can be hard to find. However, the administration is usually pretty receptive when they're not sweeping things underneath the rug. Combined with Ivy-like academics and research opportunities, I'm not concerned about my future. We have a pretty decent alumni network and job resources when you're in school-- you just have to take the extra step.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: I have loved Tulane since the very first time I laid eyes on the school. The college experience found at this university is unlike like anywhere else. The campus itself is stunning and the academics are excellent. The students are intelligent and have well-balanced lives. The weather is beautiful and the campus is always overwhelmingly green (in the best way possible!). New Orleans is a diverse, culturally rich, unique and extremely fun city. There is not one weekend that goes by where I feel bored or wonder what I should do next. In fact, there are usually too many events happening where I leave the weekend wishing I could‚Äôve fit it all in. I couldn‚Äôt be more proud of the university I attend and am so grateful for my life-changing time at Tulane.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: Great sports scene! Love the city! Love the classes! Transferred to the right place for sure. Also the warm weather is a plus
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: Tulane is fabulous. I love the professors and academic opportunities. The university is also located in a gorgeous part of New Orleans and there are lots of opportunities to get involved in the city. The campus is pretty and very walkable. It's an expensive school, but there is a lot of institutional support for students.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: Everyone is so welcoming and friendly. Environment is so lively. The city is beautiful. The students and faculty genuinely love this place, and it shows.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: Tulane's campus is just about the most beautiful campus I've ever seen. Following my tour, I went to talk to an admissions counselor and he was incredibly helpful with my questions about being deferred from early action, merit based aid I could receive, and any additional information I could provide to the university that might make me a better candidate. I ended up being put on the waitlist in early marsh, and I once again reached out to the admissions faculty. They were helpful and understanding. I ended up not only being accepted off the waitlist, but I also received a VERY generous merit scholarship and will be attending in the fall! Roll Wave!
Overall%20Experience.Author: Niche User

Overall%20Experience.Review: Zero "stars" would be more appropriate.  I wasted my freshman year at Tulane.  I transferred out.  Enough said.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Niche User

Overall%20Experience.Review: I‚Äôm infatuated with the culture of New Orleans but mostly Tulane as a whole. Academically TU is an amazing school with an inviting and unique environment that is unlike any college in America.  Socially the options are unmatched in one of the best party areas in the world. In every facet Tulane has impressed me.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: Tulane is an amazing school filled with incredibly smart, multifaceted students. It offers the opportunity to fully experience the "fun" side of college, while still being extremely academically rigorous and requires an immense amount of effort if you want to do well (academically). New Orleans is also an absolutely incredible place to be able to attend school. The professors are absolutely amazing and intelligent and if you put in the work, it will be absolutely worth it post graduating. I love Tulane so much and wouldn't have wanted to attend school anywhere else.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: I am a freshman here and could not love it more. The campus is beautiful and close-knit, the classes are small enough to build good relationships with friends and professors, there are always research opportunities and it's easy to get involved on campus.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: Tulane is unbelievable. Best time of my life.  I could not imagine going to any other school. 10/10 would recommend
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: Tulane was and is my dream school. The education that I have begun to receive at Tulane is second to none. I love Tulane for so many reasons. I have amazing friends, committed teachers, and an environment that helps me thrive. Tulane is dedicated to helping its students achieve all that they can, and I have definitely experienced that just in this first year!
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: I enjoy my time at Tulane University because they were generous enough to give me merit scholarship and financial aid to attend a prestigious private institution. I love the city of New Orleans, but the school lacks diversity and this causes issues, and it is very expensive and the school is not supportive of lower income students.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: There's no other university like Tulane. The rich New Orleans culture is so present on campus and the atmosphere is one of living life to the fullest. The students are insanely impressive and passionate but know how to balance their academics and extracurriculars with a social life.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: Beautiful campus, service oriented, many courses of study to pursue- with approachable and caring professors.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: Going to Tulane wasn't my first choice, being a native New Orleanian I wanted to go out of state.  But circumstances led me to Tulane and I couldn't be happier with my choice.  New Orleans is the most European of all American cities and the food and the experience of living there as a college student is wonderful.  The professors at Tulane know you on a personal level, the small class size allows for excellent 1-on-1 learning opportunities.  There is no place like Tulane, wherever I travel around the world I wear Tulane gear and I am always recognized and told what a great school Tulane is.  The students, faculty and the staff (Housing, food services, student services, etc.) combine to make Tulane the best university in the Solar system.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: Really awesome experience when I visited last January. The architecture school was beautiful and the whole environment was welcoming.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: I have always loved that Tulane takes care of its students. Once students get in they really do try and make sure that they succeed as best they can. Part of that is having an incredible academic atmosphere with some of the best professors in their fields, which I am incredibly grateful for. I have found problems in Tulane's reluctance to acknowledge their faults and their privilege. There is the tendency to sweep issues under the rug to preserve their sparkling exterior. They don't want to loose donors and, I think, in the process they forget about the lives of their students, the prospectus students, and the surrounding New Orleans community.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: Absolutely hate everything about my time here. The people suck, the teachers suck, and it's just a total waste of money. DON'T GO HERE!
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: Work hard, play hard type beat. Very smart kids who also know how to have fun. Use common sense and you'll thrive in this college town and college.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Niche User

Overall%20Experience.Review: Tulane sits in Uptown New Orleans and connects its students to the city in order to establish beneficial relationships.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: I loved Tulane! New orleans is the most fun city to go to college in and really adds diversity to the otherwise generic (student body wise) campus. The emphasis on community service and culture really help to embed the students into the city.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: Tulane University is a very good private university experience. New Orleans is a very friendly, welcoming, and historic city. This can be any type of school that you want, but it skews towards being a party school. Maybe this is just because I'm a freshman. Although there are many students that don't go out all the time, it can feel like that. There is a huge party culture. As a result, it can seem like no one really cares about academics.  The positive side to this is that it isn't a high pressure school.  You will have a happier existence than you would at UChicago or MIT.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: I enjoy the unique mix of international and national students that flock to Tulane for higher learning. I have met some very interesting people of different backgrounds and cultures thanks to the extensive student network that Tulane has created.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: I am a junior at Tulane. The fact that niche rates Tulane's diversity as a B+ is almost offensive. Tulane deserves a C- or maybe even a D when it comes to diversity of the student body. Lots of rich kids. Lots of them. Lots of partying. Its a good school for people that want to study business or finance -- not because the business curriculum is rigorous, but because the students you will network with while in the business school are kids whose parents own companies. You will network with students whose parents can get you jobs. Its a good school to study STEM at because the classes are easy to get into. The computer science department is too small and I don't recommend trying to study Computer Science at Tulane. Physics and Math are really good majors at Tulane because you can finish them in 6 or 7 semesters if you are willing to take a heavier course load. Core requirement classes are an annoying waste of time and money but its nice that the class sizes are relatively small.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: Rich in culture, New Orleans offers students an experience unlike any other, from the jazz-filled streets to the all-popular comfort foods. The wide selection of majors and minors allows students to pursue not just one, but many of their passions. For example, the Creative Premedicine Scholars Program gives students the opportunity to major in the School of Liberal Arts while also fulfilling pre-medicine requirements. With automatic acceptance into Tulane University's School of Medicine, the program does not require students to take the MCAT. Tulane has a beautiful campus and is constantly adding to their renovations. The Commons, moreover, is an all new dining room that offers students with a wide variety of fresh, delicious food options. The dorms are a work in progress, as some are nicer than others.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: This is a great school, and some staff are amazing. Overall, the staff does not seem to know how to help anyone who is not a standard student.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: Tulane University is great academic institution. In addition to offering students an education that sets them up for success, Tulane provides numerous opportunities for students to give back to the New Orleans community. An aspect of the school that requires attention is its lack of diversity.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior
