Overall%20Experience.Review: I attended school online and had a good experience. This was in the early days of online learning and there were no virtual classrooms.  Everything was via pre-recorded video.  However, the information I obtained continues to be relevant.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Niche User

Overall%20Experience.Review: I am beyond grateful that I chose this school. I can't imagine going anywhere else! In the college search process, I knew I wanted to live in a city but still have a campus to walk around. Tulane provides the perfect balance between the classic college campus vibe and the amazing city of New Orleans right outside the campus fence. Tulane in a word is: balanced. Everyone studies hard and cares a lot about their grades, but at the end of a long day of studying everyone loves to go out, whether at the fun frat parties or plethora of college bars. You'll never run out of things to do, on or off campus. The weather is great, the students are all happy and kind, and the place is always just full of good vibes. I have not met a single person who wishes they went somewhere else. If Tulane is right for you, you'll know because when you visit you'll feel the same passion for the school as every student. And if you don't feel passionate about Tulane, it's just not for you.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: Tulane combines a unique location, excellent educational resources, and a vibrant student life. The university only continues to invest in its campus, academics, and student life. As with any undergraduate education, students need to be active and make the school work for them. Depending on the department, disorganization can be a problem, but shouldn't stop an enthusiastic, proactive student
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review:
Tulane University is a solid school. Thoughtful professors, a stunningly beautiful campus, and an overall laid-back mentality. It can also, of course, be a crazy, chaotic party school, but only if that's the side of the school you choose to pursue.

One of the most impressive things about Tulane is its willingness to acknowledge the problems it has yet to overcome: The lack of diversity, the way its party culture provides leeway for sexual assaults, and the like. The university doesn't just recognize its shortcomings, but strives to improve. And indeed, Tulane is continually on the rise, as it seems each year to bring in a more competitively-selected batch of students.

Oh, and the new dining hall? Fantastic.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: I enjoyed going across all the opportunities they offer to  foreign students like me and I will really like to become a student of their campus to enjoy their high quality professors
Overall%20Experience.Author: Niche User

Overall%20Experience.Review: The expierence you obtain coming to Tulane is like nothing else. It's reputation as a party school is not overwhleming to the people like me who like to study. You party as much as you want to party. It is an amazing school with amazing professors I can't wait for my next 3 years here.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: There have been many changes in the program focus and organizational changes. They are cancelling the Houston based program which reduces flexibility for Houston students and confidence in the alumni association and future accessibility to continued education. The team in Houston has been great and very responsive, but have had multiple issues getting responses and help from the New Orleans campus financial aid office and business school information.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Graduate Student

Overall%20Experience.Review: Tulane was one of the greatest experiences of my life. The cultures, the food, the vibe, the music, the art, and the University itself is an amazing package. Unique to the college world, Tulane is the best in my mind and always has a special place in my heart.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: I appreciate the living spaces; the food. Although, I figure they could use more clubs. They have amazing cafeteria food, and being located near the French Quarter makes it a beautiful place to live.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Niche User

Overall%20Experience.Review: I love Tulane because its a wonderful chance to be in a city rich in culture as well as on a campus at a great university. I love that there are graduate programs available and amazing opportunities to contribute and get involved in the city as well as on campus.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: I liked pretty much all aspects of Tulane but the two main things that need work in my opinion are improving the diversity in the school and increasing the number of majors offered.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: I love Tulane. I have had the best experience here. It has great academics with an amazing social and cultural scene. I love that we have a campus but are still in close proximity to the city. There are lots of restaurants and bars in New Orleans and amazing music festivals. Tulane has a small class setting in the school of liberal arts so you really get to know your professors and it's a great learning environment.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: Tulane provides great education as well as a great college experience. I have never felt more at home at a school. Tulane has a great balance of academics and social life.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: I absolutely love Tulane University. Anyone there is passionate about learning and achieving their goals and all faculty are passionate about helping students achieve those goals. As long as the university continues to diversify, it will continue to be a wonderful school.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: It is good. I. Like.it.here.it. Is.not.boring.i.cant.wait.to.graduate.and.go.on.to.medical.scjool.and become.a.pediatrician.the.food.is.good.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: Tulane has excellent academics. It is a very fast-paced program but well worth it. The class schedules, I wish were a little better. Morning classes would be a great thing to have.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Graduate Student

Overall%20Experience.Review: I have met amazing people and professors and overall I love my time at Tulane, but it definitely is not for anyone.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: Fun school but the general atmosphere lacks a drive for academic and intellectual curiosity. The cost of the school does not match the academics.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: I went to Honors Weekend and everyone was very friendly and professional. I also sat in on a class and the teacher was engaging, knowledgable, and funny.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: Tulane food gets a bad rep but the new primary dinning hall is about to me amazing!! And Tulane hillel works as a fulll restaurant and is some of the best food that you can find at any school in the usa
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: As a predominantly white institution, it isn't the most welcoming place for people of color. After you find a stale support system, faculty who genuinely care about who success and under systemic oppression, you'll be fine.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: Tulane University seems very welcoming and has extremely advanced academic programs. I am extremely interested in attending this medical school.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Niche User

Overall%20Experience.Review: Tulane is my top choice right now. I just visited over spring break and it was amazing. I loved the positive energy and good vibes. The staff were very friendly and warm. The students seemed very happy and positive.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Niche User

Overall%20Experience.Review: Nice school. New orleans is a beautiful city. There is always something to do. A big party scene with both bars and greek life.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: I love Tulane and I cannot imagine myself at any other institution. The energy and spirit of New Orleans is unmatched and I am never bored. I love every pat of this city and of this school and I believe this is a once in a lifetime experience.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: The best thing about Tulane for me is the flexibility. Teachers and administrators will work really hard to help you accomplish your goals, even if they're out of the ordinary. With about 7000 undergrads (and growing) it's a good size and most classes are pretty small, allowing you to build relationships with your professors. It's also flexible in the sense that you can be as involved on campus and school-spirited as you like or you can run around exploring the city and both are completely acceptable. I tend to spend my time off campus because New Orleans has a fantastic, youthful energy and great alternative culture. Because the student body is so varied and people are off doing their own thing, sometimes it feels apathetic. For instance there has been a movement going on campus since 2009 to get fair pay for the workers in the dining hall, but the organizers have had a really hard time getting any kind of solidarity from the students.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Niche User

Overall%20Experience.Review: Contrary to what most people think, Tulane isn‚Äôt a crazy party school. The academics are tough and the professors are great and always open to hear questions.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: Tulane is a bubble. Lots of rich liberal kids from the east coast who spend their time JUULing and getting uber eats. Lots of spray tans. If you want to study business, Tulane is a good school because you will have the opportunity to network with lots of kids whose parents own businesses. If you are going to college so you can be pampered and have a good time, Tulane is the school for you. If you are going to college because you want to get a job in the technology industry, it is the wrong school for you. Very few networking opportunities for STEM students. Most of the professors are mediocre. Tuition is wayyyy to expensive.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: Tulane provides an academic environment that encourages and supports students to work hard to achieve their goals. The professors are excellent, the campus is perfect, and of course, NOLA is so fun!
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: While visiting everyone was very friendly and made for an incredible stay. I think for people planning to apply, there is a good chance they will get a clear idea if they visit. My visit showed me a lot about the university and made it clear to me that this was the perfect fit for me! I am so excited to be attending the school, many of the people I have met that will be in my class are very friendly and incredibly intelligent. There is also a lot of girls which is so cool! I love the liberal and open environment of the campus!
Overall%20Experience.Author: Niche User

Overall%20Experience.Review: It's been pretty great so far.  I've met nice people, liked my classes and professors, and felt like I was getting a good education.  I wish they had more internal scholarships though and I wish there were more opportunities to get involved in student groups.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Graduate Student

Overall%20Experience.Review: Tulane is providing an excellent education on a beautiful campus. I arrived as a frightened freshman as I did not come with others from my high school. After just a short time, I had plenty of friends and felt at home.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: There is very little diversity here at Tulane. Geographically, I guess. Most are from NE area.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Many of the parties revolve around sororities or fraternities.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: Tulane's teams are not the greatest but the facilities are nice.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: Not a lot of sororities so greek life is a little more competitive but no one really cares if you go greek or not
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Not a huge sports school, but have great tailgates and gym!
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Greek life grows every year
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review: Our varsity football team is lacking
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review: Sports are big part of the college culture. There are many opportunities to get involved through Campus Rec services.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: The athletics scene is there.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: A consistent ambience of friendship and cultural integration.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: The facilities are in good shape, maintenance is constantly carried out on them and we have not had any incidents of injuries or malfunctions. I believe we are on the cutting edge of sports in Tulane.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Greek life is a big part of campus life outside of studies; however, it is not necessary at all to be involved in.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: There is a lot of school spirit for our division 1 teams, despite their lack of performance.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: Greek life has definitely caused trouble for Tulane and several students I've personally met look down upon some of the Greek traditions. For example, just a couple of months ago, a fraternity made a very offensive statement by building a wall of sandbags outside their house to showcase their pro-Trump take. It got so out of hand that the football team had to go over there and take down the wall themselves.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: I'm not very involved in the athletics at my school at all, but I've heard that we don't particularly excel in any sport. Even so, there's always a big turn out for football games and a lot of school spirit.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Greek life negatively affects the social atmosphere on campus. It is not overwhelming, but provides a nonetheless noticeable pressure for students to shirk their work and attend parties. What is perhaps worse is that Tulane hires staff to clean up after the fraternities throw parties, refusing to hold these students accountable for their actions.
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review: Tulane is not a school known for sports. Our women's basketball team is fairly good fairly often, yet the men's team still garners more attention. We built a football stadium on campus, yet most students leave the game after the first quarter if they go at all. The school has excellent facilities. As President of the school's Martial Arts Club, I can attest to that. Yet, the students do not often exhibit school spirit. It becomes hard to support a team when your fellow students would rather boo at the referee than cheer when your team earns a point.
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review: Greek life is pretty prominent on campus, but if you're not part of Greek life, there are plenty of other options to get involved on campus.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: Fan support for the basketball, volleyball, baseball, and football teams should be better from students considering students get free tickets.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: Mostly upper class white kids. Pretty accepting white kids, but a bunch of white kids nonetheless.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: The party scene outside of the bars is pretty much fraternity dominated, but it's a pretty lax scene & people don't need to be a part of the Greek system to enjoy the parties. A lot more of the partying is done at the bars, honestly.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: We have pretty great facilities, but nobody really cares about sports too much here at all. I went to both the opening & homecoming games & hardly anyone stayed past the first quarter both times. Not a very athletically-centered school at all.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: For me, sorority life was not something I needed. Nonetheless, I still greatly appreciate Greek life on campus and talk to people from nearly every fraternity and sorority.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Tulane is not a school one should go to if they enjoy going to excellent sporting games. Besides baseball. We're ok at baseball.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: I am not a member of Greek life on campus, so it doesn't really affect my life except for when I want to go out on the weekends to on-campus events, which are mostly Greek events.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: If you're invested in athletics, there definitely is an atmosphere to get involved with sports on campus, but it isn't so overbearing that those who aren't interested feel they need to become involved.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: It's fine, some people like it and some people don't
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: I think that too much focus and money goes into the football team and doesn't get allocated to the academic students
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: Most people are rich, most people are white, and most people are very liberal. That being said, "most" is not all. As a rich, white, liberal person, I love Tulane and I easily make friends from similar socioeconomic backgrounds, but Tulane is a very diverse group of rich white people. Students come from all over the world, there is plenty of international students coming from Asia, Australia, Europe, South America, and Africa, and basically every American state. There is also a very prominent Jewish community at Tulane, hence the nickname "Jewlane".
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: No one really cares about athletics at Tulane, apart from the athletes. I like to think that I'm in college for the academic aspects instead.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Greek Life is really prevalent on campus, especially for freshmen and sophomores who are required to live on campus so they don't get to go to as many house parties as juniors and seniors. For freshmen, majority of the available parties are Greek parties, so it's important to either join Greek Life or have friends who rushed who can invite you. Especially in the spring semester a lot of the parties become more closed off and usually require wristbands/some sort of identification. Make friends and everything will be okay.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: It's a component of Tulane, but not mandatory to join and you can easily find friends without being involved.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Tulane is an amazing school. It wasn't my top choice, but it should have been. The community is alive and supportive, everyone is happy, and it's so easy to be involved in social life, and step away to study when needed. My favorite part is that Tulane makes their best effort to seamlessly combine social life and academic rigor throughout your four years.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Being in a sorority, I can definitely say that it has provided me with many connections around campus. Sometimes it can be a bit much, but I will never regret everyone I met through Greek Life, in and out of my sorority. Socially, I can see why people have their reservations about Greeks due to the preconceived reputations and some of the more outspoken members from each chapter, but overall everyone in it has something they're passionate about and strives to be successful.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: The athletic department here is not stellar, but there is a lot of effort put into it. There is some hope for improvement, but until then it will be largely ignored on campus.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: The top tier sororities here are full of stuck up b words. I saw plenty of my friends et cut from recruiting simply because they did not act stuck up/rude. I would argue that if you want to get into the top tier sororities, you should act rude and it would probably help your chances of getting in. The middle and bottom tier sororities have real girls, who are nice to everyone they meet. The top tier sorority girls are only nice if it benefits them mostly. I don't care about Greek life & I have friends in every sorority. When I meet girls in class who are in the top sororities though, some how they all happen to be stuck up. The fraternities I don't know much about. They host fun parties in the beginning of the year, but there is definitely a lot of hazing... and one fraternity wouldn't let my gay friend into a party once.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Tulane obviously is not a big SEC football school. The football team is not good, but the games are fun because it's a new place for people to get drunk outside of the boot/palms.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Though the sports teams at Tulane are not world-renown, the students work hard and are proud of what they do. At the same time, the student body is there to support their teams whether they win or lose.
Student%20Life.Author: College Student

Student%20Life.Review: I'm not involved, so I really can't say much. /i hear the parties are good, and most sororities/fraternities do a lot of volunteer work.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: People realy don't care about sports at Tulane. After half-time, the only people still there are in the band.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: All of the parties are thrown by fraternities.  The fraternities are a bigger deal than the sororities.  If you aren't in Greek life, you will not be an outcast, but it definitely has a major presence on campus.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Athletics are present, but are not the main focus of campus life.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Greek life is what you choose it to be. It can be your whole life or you might not notice at all depending on how much you participate.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: The school spends a lot of money on tailgating but the football team is lame. Most people leave the games after the first quarter if they attend at all.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Strongly supported by neighborhood. Athletes are dedicated and competitive.
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review: I haven't rushed yet, but greek like at tulane from what I have noticed so far seems like a worthwhile experience. Pretty much anyone can go to any of the parties, not many people care. People have friends both in and out of their sororities/fraternities.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: People just go to the tailgates, no one shows up for the games.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Nobody goes to the football games, and to get people out to basketball and volleyball games the school gives away free shirts. The baseball team is great but not everyone wants to sit through those games either.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: There are a lot of international students. Tulane has students from many many countries around the world, and it is definitely something they brag about often. However, there are definitely many more white students than any others. In terms of racial diversity, it is very lacking. Many of the students are from wealthier families as well, and the Jewish community is huge.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: It is big considering there is large participation, and most of the campus parties are frats. Frat parties happen fairly often and can be fun, but they aren't too crazy. Greeks and non-greeks get along just fine; there is really no distinction between them. It isn't super competitive like other southern schools, and it does not seem to take up as much time/effort.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Football games are definitely not anything like most other southern or SEC schools, but they can be a lot of fun. The tailgates are great, again not as huge as others, but still a good time. The rec center is really nice and accommodating for everyone.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Football is bad. No one pays attention to basketball. Baseball is my life.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: I have not rushed yet, but am planning to next semester. Sororities seem very low key here, which is great. People definitely don't seem to get their entire friend group from their sorority/fraternity. Greek parties have a presence, but they aren't too fun, and lately have started requiring wristbands for entry. Greeks and non-Greeks get along very well and there is a place for everybody within the system if they choose. It is really a non-issue one way or the other.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: I think that obsession with varsity sports would take away from the atmosphere of the school and put excess focus where it doesn't really belong, so I don't mind the lack of a sports focus. The tailgates are more heavily attended than the games themselves, which is sometimes a bit disappointing, but it really isn't a bad thing that sports are a non-issue here. Many people find their place with intramurals and club sports, all of which are amazing and lots of fun.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: The Greek life so far has only showed their party side. If they do anything for the community than it is not publicized as it should be.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Everyone, if they have time will go to the games. However, our education and prior engagements come first no matter what.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Most of Tulane's Greek life revolves around partying; if that is why you are interested in Tulane, then Tulane Greek life is for you.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Tulane is not the worst at sports, but we are far from the best. Our club men's ultimate Frisbee team (REX) is probably our top ranked team, placing in the top 25 nation wide. Our baseball and basketball teams are consistently strong, while our football team has struggled over the past several decades really. Tulane just hired a new athletic director, Tony Dannen, and a new football coach, Willie Fritz; these appointments seem to point towards a more promising future for Tulane Athletics.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Tulane's administration is solid. They are strict when they need to be but understand that we want to have fun.
Student%20Life.Author: Recent Alumnus

Student%20Life.Review: Generally it's good, but the housing department is the worst.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: They're not strict on what actually matters but I'm not complaining. I just want more parking!
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Most girls dress comfortably in nike shorts and t-shirts. Others wear nice sundresses.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Most non-Greeks don't really pay attention to the Greek students, except how the Greek life party a lot.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Yulman Stadium has brought more students to the football game. Basketball and volleyball games are fun too, but not many students attend.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Im not particularly interested in the fraternities that we have on our campus. However, the Greeks here aren't so bad.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: The campus id not that strict. The only time you will get in trouble is if you have violated a rule.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: The campus isn't very strict. If you have common sense, you won't get in trouble.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review:
When you have neighbors that blare their music until 2am, living in the dorms isn't ideal... The attendance policy also could be worked on. 

A.B. Freeman School of Business's grading policies could be edited; they are very strict.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Honestly, I only have two male friends. I don't know that many guys that are interesting. I probably just haven't found them yet.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: I have not nor do I know anyone that has gotten in any trouble this year
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: There little to no tension between greek and non-greek students.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: Greeks are well respected and seem to have a lot of fun, but it isn't a huge deal if you're not a part of Greek Life.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: it's a LOT of snotty rich northerners, not many people from the south. not many black people either. All the asians stick together. People are very liberal compared to what I'm used to coming from a prep school in the south, and I was fairly liberal compared to most of my peers back home
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: It's strong, there are some very solid chapters here in terms of the guys. They are generally regarded positively by most students, and throw fun parties every weekend. The one unfortunate thing is the lack of greek mansions like big state schools have
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: it comes down almost entirely to your RA, some of which can be pretty annoying and controlling, but are mostly pretty chill.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: The lack of school spirit can be honestly embarrassing at times, and as someone big into college football and basketball, the lack of attendance of the games is quite disappointing. Honestly if i could change one thing about the social scene here, that would be it for sure.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: The girls here are all very beautiful, the guys here are either not very attractive or jerks. A lot of the students are wealthy white privileged kids that don't have much depth to them. I have been fortunate to find both a serious boyfriend and really cool, great friends who live on my floor, but not everyone will be that lucky.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: The administration is there when you deserve the trouble. Most of the time, you can easily get away with most drinking or drug use. As long as you are not blatantly obvious, you are good.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: They became better this year since the football stadium opened on campus, however most people do not attend every game, nor is Tulane a super-spirited school.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Greek like has multiple functions every weekend.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: While there is no real "frat row", there are a bunch of frat houses across the street that hold open house parties, etc... They also hold cool fundraisers and tournaments to raise money for charity.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: Love reily and the free classes.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: I am not affiliated with a sorority. I don't view greeks differently. Although, it seems like greeks basically party all the time.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Pretty big, a lot of people are greek but since so many are they are normal overall though some sororities especially are known for being more stuck up.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: idk not the best not state school
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: So chill here, they dont care cause its NOLA
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: If you're smart, you won't get caught. Quote from someone my freshman year was "we know you're probably going to drink, but you're going to do it by our rules."
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review: What Tulane lacks in racial diversity, it makes up for in other ways. We are the most geographically diverse school in the country, and have many international students. There is a decent amount of religious diversity, although the majority of students are either Jewish or Christian. Tulane is a pretty liberal school, but there is still a decent amount of conservatives here as well.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: There are a ton of Jewish kids from the Northeast here, earning the nickname Jewlane, but surprisingly they are not the majority. You will find people from all over and from all walks of life.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Tulane is pretty lenient with a lot of things, and pretty strict with others. Overall, your RAs and TUPD are mostly concerned with your safety, but if you are being stupid (drinking in the common room, making too much noise while pregaming in your room, or smoking weed in your room) there's a chance you will get caught and written up, or worse. It's not hard at all to break these rules, you just can't be stupid about them.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: We just built a new stadium on campus, which is awesome, but games are still not very heavily attended. The tailgates and games are fun, but most people here don't really care about our football team, much less other sports.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: As a fraternity member, I have to say I am slightly disappointed at Tulane's Greek life. I'm from the South, so I was expecting huge, nice houses full of "traditional" Southern fraternities and sororities. Greek life is somewhat big here, but nothing like what you'd expect from other schools in the South.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: There is a very negative stigma from non greek guys about greek life.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: We are still celebrating the newness of Yulman Stadium!
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Don't let anyone fool you into thinking Tulane is a football school now that we have a stadium. We're still a bunch of scrawny northeasterers whose only sport is drinking.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Everyone drinks, everyone parties. Stay out of the way and you won't get in trouble for anything.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: There's not a lot of Greek influence on campus - there's visibility, but because of spring rush, everyone has both greek and non-greek friends
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: It would be better if we had a better guy to girl ratio
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: our administration looks to help us succeed
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: The boys are back uptown! We have an awesome new stadium that brings a lot of school spirit on game days which is really nice. Definitely not like any SEC school (our school is much smaller), but for the size of our school, I think we do pretty great. A lot of people play intramurals. You can find a group of kids outside practicing on any quad everyday. We have great school spirit and our students are pretty athletic. Our student athletes work very hard and are well respected
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Definitely only a handful of groups are represented (Jewish, North Eastern Prep Schooler, Southerner, etc.). However normally people don't have too much trouble finding a group to hang around. The girls are pretty attractive (above average) and I cannot speak for the male's attractiveness.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: The administration knows what goes on in and around campus and doesn't really do anything to stop it.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: There's a lot of school spirit because it's a great excuse for parties.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Visitation is strict in freshman dorms when you have to swipe in and out but once you're living in the sophomore dorms you can pretty much have as many people as you want. We have a new tobacco free policy but no one takes it seriously and people still smoke on campus. We have strict rules about drinking and doing drugs in dorms, but it's college and the RAs feel that so as long as they don't see it they're okay about it.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: I didn't rush so I don't really know specifics. Sororities and fraternities have houses but only three or four members live in them. Most members live either on or off campus. A lot of people are in sororities and frats - 70% of the girls in my graduating class rushed - but you're not treated any differently if you aren't. You just have a smaller t-shirt collection.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: No one really gets excited about sports here, but since building Yulman Stadium, people actually attend football games and tailgate for them and that's pretty fun. Other than that, no one really seems to care about sports other than the athletes themselves.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Again, this is New Orleans. Administration knows that it's hard to stop individuals from partaking in enjoyable activities, so they often try to ignore things until it becomes unavoidable.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: It provides a means of partying and social atmosphere, but many of these people are way too wrapped up in their own Greek worlds. Some adhere to the social conformity too much, which essentially keeps them in a social setting similar to that of high school.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: A lot of different variety for sororites, you can definetly tell the cliques. But frats all seem pretty similar
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Not a huge fan of sports but the first home game of the football season is a pretty big event, especially for freshmen.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: They do spot checks on freshman dorms but usually if you actually comply with them they won't even write you up, or you may just get off without a warning. It's a little ridicuolous that playing "drinking games" (water pong even) with non-alcoholic drinks or having empty alcohol containers is considered a drinking violation.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Campus strictness varies depending on circumstance and authority. Although most students partake in underage drinking, they are severely punished if they are caught.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Sports are a significant part of campus life. Football games are a very important event in the year, and everyone is involved in some way. The school spirit is extremely high for these games. Most students partake in some intramural sports.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: There is not much diversity at Tulane. Much of the population is white, although there is a strong black and asian population.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Greek life is prevalent but not essential to a student's happiness at Tulane. It is a southern school, so the chapters have many values rooted in old, southern traditions. However, there is a variety of chapters, enough so that each student can find his or her fit.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: The general population of girls and boys at Tulane is quite preppy. There are a lot of students from privileged backgrounds, some coming from the NorthEast or the South, and many from California. That said, a great many defy the "country club" stereotype.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: one of the most noticeable lacking aspects of tulane however the football team is on the rise and I would predict that well be top in the Big East, which we just joined, in the next 2-3 years. roll wave, baby.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: greek life is pretty big at tulane and you definitely notice their presence at certain times during the year, like the first few weeks, however if you are not greek and still a sociable person you get to enjoy many of the parties that occur on campus. it can be mainly about who you know
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: its a relatively homogenous place with alot of people from the northeast along with a lot of jewish american students. however it is not much of a problem for many who find diverse groups of people and friends
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Work hard, play hard, to the extreme.  And you'll never stop meeting new and interesting people who love having a good time
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: As can be expected, some dorms/RA's aren't gonna let stuff slide, but most RA's will completely turn a blind eye
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Not very economically or racially diverse, but not as bad politically as some colleges are
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Greek life can be good and bad.  There are some frats and sorors that are utterly awful, and there are some that are doing okay.  Tulane has had most of greek life suspended numerous times for being too crazy.
Student%20Life.Author: Recent Alumnus

Student%20Life.Review: There is very little diversity on campus.  Tulane could do with a little more multiculturalism.
Student%20Life.Author: Recent Alumnus

Student%20Life.Review: The Tulane Police Department and the administration is usually pretty lenient with alcohol, but they do take marijuana and other drug use inside the dorms pretty seriously. The honor code is also strictly enforced
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: The school will have a new stadium up this year, but our football team is not very good... so we'll see what happens. Club sports are very popular, and students are able to manage their time well while participating in them.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: There isn't much diversity on campus. That's one of Tulane's biggest flaws; however, there has been an active effort over the past couple of years... so only time will tell I guess?
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: Most of the guys look the same. Mainly preppy, new englanders. Not much eye candy.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: Tulane is very accepting. There is not an overwhelming majority of one specific group that runs campus.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: As long as you have a good relationship with your RA you should be fine.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: If you want to go greek, Tulane is a great place, and many students who do not plan on rushing before spring semester end up doing it.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Freshman mostly just hook up, go to the boot to find that. Sophomores and on have more relationships and you can choose what type of experience you want to have.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: The football program will continue to get bigger at Tulane with the addition of the new football stadium. I expect this rating to improve.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: There are many international students in the graduate programs.
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review: The strict policies I think is an advantage to the students and staff of the campus.
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review: No one goes to varsity sporting events. They're building the new on campus football stadium though so now more people will go probably, if not just for tailgating. Our football team is also getting a lot better which makes them more fun to watch. Intramural sports are pretty big, a lot of the freshman dorm floors and most organizations have intramural sports teams.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: Some of the guys live in the fraternity houses, but girls don't live in the sorority houses as a result of an old brothel law causing our houses to not be built with bedrooms. Greek life is pretty big but it's not a big deal if you don't join. You can still go to the frat parties or be invited to the sorority parties. Mostly everyone I know is in greek life though. There are some non greeks that don't like greek life, but overall it seems that the relationship is pretty good.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: There's not that much diversity on campus, but everyone is really accepting.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: For the most part unless you get a really strict RA, there's a lot of freedom at Tulane as long as you don't abuse it.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: Most Tulane students are really wealthy and from the northeast or California. For the most part everyone's really friendly and since it's such a small school everyone knows each other. Most people aren't into relationships though, so dating is pretty rare among underclassmen. More of the juniors and seniors decide to settle down and start relationships.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: Some are cool people others can be a bit snobby
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Never had problems, but other students will run into to some if not careful.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: The ethnic diversity is lacking but character diversity is huge.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: It all depends on what kind of people you are into.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Our team did very well last year. A lot of people enjoy going to the football games but it is sometimes hard to catch the bus and make it to the Super Bowl. Also, some students don't like feeling like they have to be on a strict schedule as to when they can go to and leave the game, as they have to go by the bus schedule. I think next year when our new football stadium is open our school spirit will see a drastic change as it will be within walking distance, allowing students to get there easily and have school-wide pre games before.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: A large percentage of Tulane students are white kids from affluent backgrounds. Judaism is the dominant religion at Tulane, earning it it's nickname of "Jewlane". Tulane boasts that it's the most geographically diverse school in the nation, but the bulk of students tend to come from the NE (NY, CT, NJ, MA), IL, CA, LA, and TX. I wish there was more of a presence of international students on campus.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: Sororities are much larger than fraternities size-wise, and I think that there's definitely more pressure to go through Rush if you're a girl. Greek life can definitely feel a bit exclusive at times if you're not a part of it. Joining a fraternity or sorority only consumes as much of your time as you let it though. It's easy to have friends who aren't involved in Greek life if you are or vice versa, it just requires putting in the same amount of effort that you would into any friendship.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: The girls definitely carry themselves well. While a large percentage of them are extremely privileged and stuck up, there are also a lot of really cool, down-to-earth girls at Tulane, and people often forget this when describing the school. Attending a school with such a high price tag will undoubtedly guarantee that you'll be amongst entitled kids. The boys are pretty similar, a lot of them are incredibly fratty and preppy.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: TUPD does a great job of focusing primarily on keeping students safe, rather than getting them in trouble. Unless you're blasting music and drinking loudly in the dorms (specifically in freshmen dorms), you probably won't get in trouble. Considering there are multiple bars steps away from campus, there's really no reason to party in your dorm room.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: girls are better than the guys
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: I wish there was more school spirit
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Athletics at Tulane is alright sports wise. I feel like club and intramural sports are much more popular, and there is a definite lack of school spirit around campus.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review:
Still wishing for more Tulane team spirit/fan support at most varsity sport events. There are always a lot of people at the first home football game, the homecoming game, and the Tulane/LSU baseball game. Men's basketball is also pretty well-attended. Other than that, though, don't hope for much unless the new football stadium changes things up.

Intramurals are serious, especially basketball. Some teams even make their own jerseys to play. Club sports are pretty popular, too. Club teams travel and compete all over the country and they're usually a pretty tight-knit group of people.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: There is no typical Tulane student - that's the best part. Whatever social group you belong to, you'll probably find it at Tulane. (If you're more of the hipster type, though, cross Freret over to Loyola and you'll find a LOT more there.)
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: Tulane Greek life is pretty famous for how hard it parties, so if you're looking for that, you've come to the right place. About 30% of the total undergraduate population is Greek. For girls, it ends up being about 50% Greek, 50% unaffiliated depending on the year. You can very easily have a social life without being in Greek life. Non-Greeks view Greeks differently depending on what fraternity/sorority they're in and based on their general views.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: The guys and girls are preppy, well off and white. Greek life is huge and regardless of what people may seem like (independent or otherwise) when you first get here, most will join Greek life. Politics wise, it is very mixed but the diversity ends there, most people are apathetic to causes. There is a subculture of vegetarians, activists, adventurers and environmentalists, but all of those tend to apply to that subculture and you will see the same people in ALL of those club meetings. If Greek life isn't for you and you are not an athlete, there is a high chance Tulane isn't for you.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Tulane is incredibly homogenous. I couldn't believe how homogenous it was when I got here... they really need to look into fixing that.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Honestly, if you're smart you'll be fine.  Next year they are making campus "smoke free" so I'm not sure how that will be.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Students here don't have a passion for athletics.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: I think if you make the effort and choose wisely, it can be the one of the best decisions you can make at school.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: I have met a wide range of types of people, but overall the student body is relatively homogenous.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: You can get away with a lot as long as you aren't dumb.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Definitely not big state school (SEC-like) Greek Life. Houses are not opulent but old and small and in residential neighborhood. Options are limited. Definitely not a typical greek life vibe either. Some people like it but if you think its gonna be like Ole Miss or LSU just because Tulane is in the South it you're wrong. They don't even dress the same.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Rich white kid hook up culture. So many white people. The people who go to school here are either affluent white kids who messed up and didn't get into a better school (or where they go doesn't matter) or weird nerds who go for the academics. Take it or leave it. There are plenty of awesome people who go to school here but those two stereotypes permeate.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: We aren't known for sports. The football team is getting better and we're getting a stadium. Intramural/Club sports are there but some facilities for example, Tennis are limited.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: The non-Southern guys are some of the worst. I'm not at all saying that non-Southern guys are inherently bad, but we just happen to have admitted all the ones that don't think it's necessary to hold doors open for girls or text them the day after a hookup. The girls are better but there are some that fall under this category as well.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: With the building of the new on campus football stadium, Tulane athletics is about to become a much bigger deal.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Tulane Greek Life is becoming increasingly bigger with each year. The number of girls who rush breaks the record every year, and it also becomes more competitive every year. This year was the most competitive yet, as only about 1/3 of the girls who rushed made it into a sorority. Boys rush is a little different, but I was surprised by how many boys didn't get bids from anywhere.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: If you really want to go to a diverse school, don't go to Tulane (aka Jewlane). Otherwise, it's not that noticeable and doesn't bother me.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: As long as you don't bother anyone then you literally will never get in trouble. Once in a while there's undercover cops at the bars but just don't be stupid and you'll be fine.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: You don't have to be in the Greek life system in order to be in the social scene - it's just not necessary. But, of course there will be some perks regardless of that fact.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Not a lot of diversity here on campus. It's an issue the school leaders talk about constantly, but it doesn't seem like it has been made out to be changed.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: "Rich and whiter than a cheesecake."
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: They not at all strict
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: There is a balance you want in college; freedom, but also to feel safe on campus and in your dorm. Tulane has this balance down.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: About one third of students are in greek life. Rushing is one of the most stressful times, but if you choose not to join, its no big deal.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: I am a grad student so i can't comment on underage drinking.
Student%20Life.Author: College Senior

Student%20Life.Review: There are a lot of Jewish people. There are not that many minorities but the school is definitely geographically diverse which is what makes the school unique.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Although Greek life is not a huge part of Tulane, you can definitely tell who is and is not in a sorority or fraternity. Greek life is still a part of the university and is very involved academically and socially.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Student athletics have a lot of popularity on campus and certainly are some of the highlights of teamwork/cooperation among the student body.  Athletics are a significant factor in common interests.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: There are many different ethnic groups but they are small in numbers and sometimes tend to stick to people of the same race
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: I love how lenient Tulane is. You're free to live your life as long as you don't smell, burn something, or plagiarize a paper.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Fun, balanced, easy way to meet people. Can cut into your self-esteem a little bit though during rush. Just saying.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Mostly WASPs and Jewish American Princesses. A ton of kids have a ton of money, but not everyone.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: No one cares, to be honest. Every freshman goes to the first football game, but we're an academically focused school, so sports teams just aren't very important to the average student. With the building of the new football stadium, that may change in the next few years, however, as of now, if you're looking for a "football school," Tulane ain't your cup of tea.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Joining greek life beings in the second semester with 8 sororities and about the same fraternities. It is not a huge part of campus life you join if you get along with the people who do it and if not then social life is perfectly fine there are no issues  between greeks and non-greeks I am aware of and it is a choice that each student makes if they feel they want to join the organization.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: The campus police are there so that you remain safe. They are not looking to bust you if you remain respectful.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Haven't seen too many police or security guards during my semester
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Couldn't say it is better or worse than any other school.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: The school is very diverse.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: There are all different types of students from young to old.
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: Not many people care about the football team. The saints are more important
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Tulane boasts great geographical diversity but fails to mention a mostly homogenous population of rich caucasians. A large asian population keeps to itself, and the gender and sexual diversity is less than one would hope.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: I would like for there to be more school spirit, which will hopefully increase once the new on-campus football stadium is completed and students don't have to travel downtown to the Superdome for football games. The lack of a varsity soccer team is also detrimental to the school spirit. Intramural and club sports seem to be fairly popular and a good physical outlet for students.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Tulane is fairly lenient when it comes to underage drinking and visitors in dorms, however they could step up when it comes to noise violations in the dorms during quiet hours.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Personally, I find many of Tulane's students to be quite shallow and naive, with little knowledge of the real world and cushion of money to fall back on.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Greek life at Tulane is pretty big because they pretty much host all of the parties. You don't have to join, but most people rush anyways.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: There is pretty much no diversity on campus. They call it Jew-lane for a reason. The average student is white, jewish, and from the tri-state area.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Tulane has great athletic facilities and the students like to stay fit. However, the varsity sports are very under attended. Once we join the American conference next year and play bigger D1 schools it should get a lot better.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: They're not too strict, but if you get an RA that bad it could hurt your experience.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: On my campus, you can find many different guys and girls coming from a lot of different places in the United States and the world. They all have different personalities but one main thing that most of the girls and boys have is partying.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: The rules are strictly upheld on my campus by the administrators as far as I have seen. The administrators, or at least the Resident Hall administrators, constantly remind us about the rules.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Academics is much more important in my school than sports.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: The guys are so hot at Tulane. The girls are really pretty too.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Students are very diverse here. LGBT and other multicultural groups greatly integrate students onto campus.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Athletics is a big part of Tulane, and this year our teams have improved tenfold.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Tulane University is a very laid back school.  The school does not interfere in the lives of its students and generally expects you do be responsible for yourself.
Student%20Life.Author: Recent Alumnus

Student%20Life.Review: I think Tulane is a very diverse college
Student%20Life.Author: College Junior

Student%20Life.Review: Tulane definitely lacks school spirit but interest in sports is growing. The football team is getting better and school spirit will change next year once the on-campus stadium is finished.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: There is definitely a presence on campus and they fraternities throw parties every weekend. However, if you chose to not partake in greek life you will not feel left out.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Unless you're acting outrageously and flaunting alcohol in front of a cop, you probably won't get in trouble.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Most students are fairly affluent from the northeast, Chicago, Texas, and California area. Tulane definitely lacks diversity. With that being said, if you are not of the aforementioned group, you will not feel different or left out. Students are generally accepting.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Most Tulane students are fit and concerned with their appearance. Most people dress fairly nicely and are physically active.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Everything will change next year when football is brought on campus.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: The irresponsible people weed themselves out at the end of freshman year.  The school puts a lot of faith in us.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Lots of jews.  A lot of wealthy kids from the northeast.  Then again, you will find this at almost any top tier competitive university.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: A bunch of bros here, really cool guys to hang around.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: A bunch are on probation right now.  But, once they clean up their act the fraternities should be thriving.
Student%20Life.Author: College Freshman

Student%20Life.Review: Sororities and Fraternities are a big part of campus life, especially in regards to parties. It's difficult to get into some as they are exclusive.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Student%20Life.Review: Just as at any university, there are the good and the bad when it comes to guys and girls.
Student%20Life.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: Tulane truly does have incredible academics and professors once you move away from gen eds.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: It can get really tough sometimes, especially the workload. However I definitely think the profs & classes are some of the best available & really think the classes & academics are very worth while.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: Most professors are extremely smart and caring. Help is easily available outside of class if needed, including in large lecture courses, and most of the teachers will try to learn all of the students' names. It's important to be on good terms with the teachers to be able to get involved in research etc. Getting all As is not easy, especially in the Science department. I know very few people with perfect GPAs, but often it's not GPAs that really matter. Even if I don't always end up with straight As, I really feel like I'm learning a lot at Tulane and the classes are not just "easy As" but fascinating subjects that I'm really learning a lot about.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: Workload is manageable but challenging.  Professors are generally great.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review:
I absolutely love the fact that in college you get to choose what classes you take. Tulane has broad requirements that you have to complete, but a large variety of classes fit these requirements. Being able to study what you're passionate about makes school so much more interesting--I strongly recommend coming to college to learn about something you love, not just to get a job someday.

I'm a liberal arts major, so there's a lot of reading involved. The best advice I received coming to college was to pick and choose what readings you do, which is easy to do once you feel out the class and professor and figure out what's essential to complete. Otherwise, skimming/finding a summary is okay. I've never felt like the workload was unmanageable, and I'm a big procrastinator. 

The registration process can be frustrating, especially when you have a later time to register and the classes you're most excited about are filled up. I'd suggest getting on as many waitlists as you need to, and keep checking back if there isn't a waitlist. Just today, I checked a small, hugely popular class that had been filled for months and there was an open spot! There are so many fascinating class options, I'm really satisfied with the course offerings.

I love to study in my room and at the PJs on Willow, but others utilize dorm common rooms, the library, the LBC, or anywhere outside because the weather is amazing.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: Academics at Tulane are great. They are definitely getting better and better every year. There is a wide variety of interesting classes to take. Classes are small enough to get individual attention. The professors are very easy to reach and helpful. Tulane will definitely be going up in the rankings.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: People don't seem to care enough about their work. Not enough of my peers are academically engaged.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: academics are awesome generally, though the math department, especially at introductory levels, is made up almost entirely of bumbling fools who have no business having anything to do with any institution of higher learning (aka if you take a math class freshman or sophomore year, you better pray for a good TA, or you WILL have to learn the material on your own.) Other than that though, the academics kick ass
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: There are a lot of awesome and friendly teachers, who are super helpful and can help you find great opportunities and internships and whatnot
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: If you can get into the school, you can handle the workload of the school.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: I wished I would have more opportunities to get more credits.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: Academics is the reason I came here.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: It's very easy to switch majors or to double major here. I have had some amazing professors and some less than satisfactory ones. The math intro classes have notoriously bad professors, but are a requirement for every major.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: It depends on what you make of them: there are the resources to be challenged if you take advantage of them.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: Sociology does not have strong research atmosphere.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: Tulane makes it very easy for anyone to switch into any school. You do not have to reapply or anything. All you have to do is see your professor.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: The B school has the best facilities and resources compared to any other school here at Tulane. The buildings are nicer, you get more individual attention, you get break out rooms, and more printing.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: I'm business and I never had to apply specifically to get into the Freeman business school.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: The business school is well funded and has the most students of any program on campus. Tulane definitely focuses a lot on the business program and they're always bringing in speakers and job fairs and stuff specifically for us. We also have a huge alumni network. If you're a business major, you have to study abroad through the business school, which is kind of annoying because they don't have as many places to go as say a liberal arts major, but they're adding more every year.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: I am enjoying it. I like the availability of the professors. I like the service learning requirement.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: Registration is easy if you came in with a lot of AP credit. I got to register as a sophomore when I was a freshman because I came in with 25 credits. Professors are generally great, the workload varies, and there are tons of good studying areas, mainly the library, PJs, and the 2nd floor of the LBC
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: Finance is a pretty popular major, so there are tons of classes available. Also a lot of the finance courses are required for all business school majors. The business school facilites are pretty nice, with a stockroom simulation room. Also a lot of finance courses prepare you for real-life situations. One class consists of just compiling Burkenroad reports (common for businesses in the South I believe) with the professor, and another class involves keeping a stock portfolio and seeing how well you do.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: it can definitely be rewarding depending on your major. many perks for business school students like myself and architecture students. lowkey tulane has one of the best architecture programs in the nation
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: football team is getting better coming off our first winning season in a while. we made a bowl game but unfortauntely lost on a missed field goal. Still we should be steadily improving with the addition of a stadium on campus this coming fall. Roll wave baby.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: The curriculum here is challenging, but rewarding.
Academics.Author: College Senior

Academics.Review: I really enjoy the finance program. It is difficult, but worth it. A lot of attention is put on the business school at Tulane, so we get a lot of perks. We also get a lot of help with job and internship searches.
Academics.Author: College Junior

Academics.Review: Most of our undergrad programs don't require a separate application to get into, so you can very easily change your major and eve change schools.
Academics.Author: College Junior

Academics.Review: The theatre program is great. Many people are friends and the professors treat you as equals more so then other departments.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: I have learned a lot and professors are always helpful.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: Tulane is definitely a challenging school, but the higher up you go in the curriculum for your major, the more interesting the courses get!
Academics.Author: College Junior

Academics.Review: I wish Tulane didn't force students to waste away their first few semesters by taking requirement courses. However, once you start taking courses for your major, it's worth it. I have had incredible professors for every major course that I have taken. The only professors I've disliked have been ones who are teaching general requirement classes.
Academics.Author: College Junior

Academics.Review: I'm an English major at Tulane University. It's okay. We don't get much attention, and there's only one honors course offered in the whole department. But we have some really cool teachers. I can't wait to see what's to come.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: Internships can count for college credit and the Center for Public Service partners with local organizations to provide some specifically to fulfill your second-tier service learning credit, too. If you do it for college credit you won't be paid, but you'll knock some classes off of your list and get job experience at the same time.
Academics.Author: College Junior

Academics.Review: I'm in the Business school and I'm given a multitude of free resources that are very nice. I can't speak for other schools within Tulane, but most of my professors have been great, though  I have had a few really awful ones.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: I didn't have any problems at all getting into the major that I am currently pursuing.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: There isn't a down side to it as of right now, so it's okay.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: I think the workload overall is fair and the Public Health and Business School are very respected and well-established. As a business school student, I have found a lot of difficulties and disappointments along the way.
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: Many good people and ways to make good connections and the school will help you line everything out as well.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: They are overall good I guess. Many places have some pretty significant holes. For example, the math/sciences have lots of very nonfluent professors. We have architecture but no civil engineering. Public Health and the Business school require enrollment to take classes in them even though they tell you everything is free roam. But we have to ranked highly for a reason, right?
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: If you love what you're studying, then you definitely can't go wrong with your classes. If you're a little unsure, then you might come across a few classes that you struggle to get to in the mornings.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: Tulane is a very good school and the academics reflect that. If you can get in here then you can definitely handle the course-load.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: Just enough work to feel like you're learning, but not to much to overwhelm.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: The professors for the most part are difficult to understand their english
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: So far, its great-- good classes, good teachers for the most part.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: The professors in MIcrobiology/Immunology are really great and always willing to help.
Academics.Author: College Senior

Academics.Review: Despite the heavy accents of some professors, the classes are interesting and challenging.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: I have only just now started taking classes for my major
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: since i got into the business school when i first applied switching majors was very easy
Academics.Author: College Sophomore

Academics.Review: As I said previously, "work hard, play hard" is a very real thing at Tulane. Students are smart and held to high standards.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: I'm obsessed with how well the "work hard, play hard" motto works at Tulane. Courses are challenging and work intensive without burning students out, and the course varieties are awesome. Small classes are abundant, and TA's teaching full time AREN'T ALLOWED! It's really great.
Academics.Author: College Freshman

Academics.Review: Liberal arts majors are flexible, plus it's easy to triple major.
Academics.Author: College Freshman
